I cannot put into words my deep and abiding despair in this game.  The devs accidently made something pretty good, that needed some work on the fundamental game mechanics.  Over the years, they have applied bandaid after bandaid on top of that wound, but it festered and now I don't think they ever will fix it.  as a killer you feel like very little of the game is an active choice, you just follow around a survivor until they make a mistake.  As a survivor, after around five hours and the initial shock of "ahhh, spooky killer" wears off your part of the game is boring as hell until you finally get chased.

After 500 hours i find this game still good, but there are some cons

Pro:
-Different Killer and Perks (changes the way people play a bit)
-Different Survivors and Customization(Always cool)
-Requires Teamwork(You can't do everything alone)
-You have to listen alot(To find out where the Survivors/Killer are/is)

Cons:
-Toxic Community(Teabagging,Trolling etc.)
-Some bugs
-RAGE(mostly as killer because people palletloop or a whole Team uses flashlights)

And thats about it
A great game for friends, or you could become a killer main, we don't have friends. :(

Deswegen mein erster Satz.

EDIT ( 5/20/2021 ): Majority of my last edit is still the same but if I could give the game a "middle" rating I would. Some issues have been fixed such as broken and abused perks and the addition of crossplay has expanded the audience significantly as well as letting friends on different platforms play together.

- Survivor ques are still long at times and they are the power role still majority of the time if they know what they are doing
- Older killers have been getting reworked slowly and are becoming viable again but the top killers still remain the same for the most part
- SWF hasn't been balanced at all still
- Rift system is a grindy mess at times with some of its challenges, but isn't near as bad as its first iteration

"Would you suggest getting into this game?": Its hard to say honestly. I'd say yes only if you can deal with the toxicity that surrounds this game as I've said before and can ignore some of the questionable balance decisions at times.

Devs are only human and with this game being on so many platforms, I can understand if keeping this balanced is a massive pain at times.

---------------------------------

EDIT ( 2/4/2020 ): Honestly I cannot recommend the game right now in its current state. Yes it can be fun at times, but honestly the balance is REALLY BAD now. These days matches are either finished really quickly due to how fast survivors get generators done or everyone dies due to gens being ignored and feeding a killer that is camping.

SWF ( Survive with Friends ) STILL has not been balanced yet and it'll only take a couple matches against obvious super coordinated SWF teams to see the issue. Some killers may enjoy the challenge but most do not due to how much voice communication "if used" breaks the game.

You can still manage as killer if you don't mind the amount of stress at seeing matches fly by and have a thick skin to deal with the salt flung at you when you do win. In general though its slowly coming down to either using the meta killers/perks or you'll get gen rushed to death. But the devs also keep nerfing the best perks at slowing gens down WITHOUT addressing gen speed.

As survivor you can usually manage solo once you get over the beginning "fear". The only time you'll struggle is when learning the different killer mechanics or if your paired with survivors who just ignore gens for whatever reason. Looping around pallets is also still a thing so theres that.

As someone who has played and followed the game since the beginning, I honestly suggest not getting into the game right now. Follow it for a bit if you want and see if the devs fix the gen speeds among other balance issues.

TLDR:
- Both sides are boring/unfun now for different reasons
- Balance is poor and matches end too quick
- Community is still very toxic/salty
- Not worth getting into unless you have thick skin and can stand matches ending stupidly quick along with the general toxicity/salt that comes from if you manage to win as killer

-----(Original review below)-----

Amazing game thats just dragged down quite a bit due to its community.

You'll see the typical trollish behaviour of people rage quitting and then insulting you if they lose, etc. If you decide to pick the game up just be prepared to deal with toxic players from both sides of the community. As a killer just remember to play however you choose and don't let others tell you how you should. As a survivor just try not to do things to purposefully be annoying towards the killer because they are an actual human being and want to enjoy the game as well.

The game has a steep learning curve and the grind has been reduced quite a bit from when the game first launched so don't get discouraged so quickly. Matches can be amazingly fun or over super quickly so you never know what your getting into or what killer your going to be facing. Once you get the hang of it you'll be able to start experimenting with different loadouts and try to find one that suits your playstyle accordingly.

I would also strongly suggest you read up on the games offical website to learn about the different killer and survivor perks so you know who to level up first since you can eventually allow a killer's or survivor's specific perks to be used on other killers and survivors respectedly.

Finally remember this:

As a survivor focus on surviving, you DO NOT have to go and help others if you choose not to.

As killer your goal is to SACRIFICE survivors, you DO NOT have to give them multiple chances of escape if you choose to.

Hope to see you in the fog either way!
